content.rendered:
Europe Africa Division

Sébastien Morant, born in 1963, holds an engineering degree from the Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics. After working as a volunteer consultant with the Ministry of Public Works in Djibouti in 1987, he started his career the following year with Sogea in Corsica as an engineer, before becoming Head of Civil Engineering for south-west France until 1997. Sébastien Morant then held the position of Regional Director for Sogea Antilles Guyane until 2002, when he was promoted to Managing Director of Sogea Satom (VINCI Construction African subsidiaries) and then Chairman of VINCI Construction Filiales Internationales (Africa, Overseas France and Europe) in 2006. 

In 2010, he joined VINCI Autoroutes and the ASF network as Chief Operating Officer, then Managing Director, and later as Managing Director and then Chairman of the Escota network. He became Managing Director of VINCI Autoroutes in 2014, before moving to Eurovia as Deputy Managing Director in charge of Canada in 2019. 

As of February 2021, Sébastien Morant heads the Europe Africa Division within the VINCI Construction pole.

excerpt.rendered: As of February 2021, Sébastien Morant heads the Europe Africa Division within VINCI Construction.
